intro: Gilia leptalea, commonly known as the slender gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its slender stems and delicate foliage make it a distinctive member of its genus. Gilia leptalea is often found in the Great Basin and surrounding regions, where it thrives in arid to semi-arid conditions.
